channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: County Down: Teenager dies after entering water at Canal Court
item.description: The incident happened in the village of Scarva at about 15:30 on Monday afternoon.

item.title: Covid-19: Vaccination centres ending first doses on 31 July
item.description: NI's chief scientific officer says about 18% of adults have not come forward for their first dose.

item.title: Tony Blair's Irish Famine message not signed off by him, archive papers show
item.description: Files show the former PM's private secretary wrote the statement but could not reach him for approval.

item.title: NI Assembly to debate Troubles legacy proposals
item.description: The assembly recall follows government plans to end prosecutions for Troubles-related offences.

item.title: Jordanstown: Motorcyclist dies after Shore Road crash
item.description: No other vehicle was involved in the crash on the Shore Road on Monday night, police say.

item.title: Belfast boxer to carry Irish flag at Olympics
item.description: Belfast boxer Brendan Irvine and team-mate Kellie Harrington will carry the Irish flag at the Tokyo Olympics opening ceremony on Friday.

item.title: Covid-19: Some NI children over 12 to be offered vaccine
item.description: Children with specific underlying health conditions can now receive the Pfizer/BioNtech vaccine.

item.title: Coronavirus: Group meets over Northern Ireland dental services
item.description: Many NI dentists are considering pulling out of providing NHS dental care, it has been warned.

item.title: NI's new record temperature could be exceeded this week, says Met Office
item.description: After the thermometer hit 31.2C on Saturday, even more hot weather is due, says the Met Office.

item.title: NI water warns 'significant number' risk losing supply
item.description: Areas under greatest pressure include Cookstown, Magherafelt, Newry and Dungannon, NI Water says.

item.title: 'It's golf with guns' - Kirsty Hegarty's Tokyo journey
item.description: Trap shooter Kirsty Hegarty tells BBC Sport NI all about trap shooting and a surprising addition to her Team GB kit which got her rather excited.

item.title: NI heatwave: Police run out of parking tickets at Ballintoy Harbour
item.description: As temperatures soared on Sunday, police issued 30 fixed penalty notices for parking offences.

item.title: Ulster SFC final: Croke Park to stage Monaghan v Tyrone decider
item.description: Croke Park is confirmed as the venue for the Ulster Senior Football Championship final between Monaghan and Tyrone.

item.title: Covid-19: One further death and 1,776 positive cases in NI
item.description: There are currently 109 patients with Covid-19 in NI hospitals, seven of whom are in intensive care.

item.title: Walk-in vaccine clinics open across NI
item.description: Anyone aged 18 can now get a Covid-19 at walk-in centres across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: Southern Trust suspends hospital visits as cases spike
item.description: The decision was taken as NI recorded its highest daily number of coronavirus cases since January.

item.title: Interim Covid vaccine certificates to be launched for NI travellers
item.description: Anyone travelling from Northern Ireland after the 25 July should wait to use a new app.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hospitality Ulster calls for NI recovery strategy
item.description: Industry representatives say businesses are struggling after lockdown and need help from Stormont.

item.title: River Blackwater: Silt blockage 'damaging fishermen and tourism'
item.description: A build up of silt has blocked a section of the River Blackwater near Lough Neagh for 15 years.

item.title: Ann Murray, the illegal poteen distiller who lived in a cave
item.description: Ann Murray spent 50 years living and producing her own alcohol in County Antrim's Red Bay Caves.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Mary Ann McCracken letters shed new light on last years
item.description: The anti-slavery campaigner was active in Belfast well into her 90s, new letters reveal.

item.title: Hottest NI day ever as temperatures soar above 30C
item.description: Ballywatticock near Newtownards records 31.2C on Saturday, breaking a record set 45 years ago.

item.title: Dentists in Northern Ireland 'considering pulling NHS services'
item.description: Dentists say they are considering pulling NHS services because of the effect of Covid-19 restrictions.

item.title: River Blackwater: 'We last got through safely in 2006'
item.description: A campaign group calls for a section of the River Blackwater to be cleared of a silt blockage

item.title: From Game of Thrones to A&E to Tokyo Olympics
item.description: Irish rower Philip Doyle tells BBC Sport NI about his role in Game of Thrones, working for the NHS as a trainee doctor during the Covid-19 pandemic and his Olympic hopes

item.title: Water shortage: 'Don't use water for things that aren't necessary'
item.description: NI Water says demand may outstrip supply as usage increases in the dry weather.

item.title: Lu Na McKinney: Judge in murder trial begins summing up evidence
item.description: The body of Lu Na McKinney was found in the water beside a jetty on Lower Lough Erne in 2017.

item.title: All-Ireland MFC: Derry’s future ‘looks bright’ after Tullamore triumph
item.description: Oak Leaf captain Matthew Downey has ‘one up’ on legendary dad Henry after helping Derry to victory over Kerry in the All-Ireland minor final.

item.title: Derry win All-Ireland Minor Football Championship
item.description: Derry leave it late to beat Kerry by 2-12 to 1-14 and win a first All-Ireland Minor final in 19 years at Tullamore.

item.title: Colum Eastwood: MP reveals death threats after naming Soldier F
item.description: Colum Eastwood named the former paratrooper, accused of two Bloody Sunday murders, in Parliament.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ireland eases international travel restrictions
item.description: People who have "valid proof" of full vaccination no longer have to self-isolate on arrival.

item.title: Covid-19: Ireland's top medical officers targeted by abusive calls
item.description: Gardaí are investigating reports of abusive calls to Ireland's chief medical officer and his deputy.

item.title: Brendan Óg Duffy: Monaghan GAA U20s captain dies in car crash
item.description: Brendan Óg Duffy lost his life just hours after captaining the Monaghan team to a semi-final win.

item.title: Brexit: UK urged to match 'generosity of spirit' over protocol
item.description: European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen says the protocol is "the only solution".

item.title: Inhaler: Bono's son and his band top UK chart with debut album
item.description: Elijah Hewson's rock group knock Olivia Rodrigo off the top spot with their debut album.
